instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2327: What is 820-2327? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message:
Hello guys,

ancient board, I know, but still practicing.

Board was clean except some mild corrosion on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. Replaced the chip and now I get 8.15V at pin 1 of L7000. When I plug in a good battery I get 12V on pin 1 of L7000. I short the <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> pads, no fan spin.

What next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28? Resistance to GND on 3V42 rail?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message: Am I supposed to measure resistance between these pins with the MagSafe disconnected? That's what I did and resistance between pins 17/18 is 21.2 Ohm, 27/28 is 20.5 Ohm. Resistance to GND on 3v42 rail is 0.324.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message:
All without power of course. Resistance to GND on 3V42 is 0.342 what? Is that diode mode? I need resistance.
You did replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> with <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> and not 6259?
Green light ok?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message: You are right, I measured in diode mode. Resistance to GND on 3V42 is 22.84 kOhms. Taking a closer look I saw that there has been worked on this board before. <CHIP>U2801</CHIP> was missing and I put it back in place. Now I get a fan spin for about 10 seconds, short pause for 2 seconds and then spins infinitely. Is this board dead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message: On/Off and On again is the worst you can have. The only easy fix would be if CPU Vcore is not coming on. If there is Vcore on L7400 then this board is trash.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message: I get 0.989V on pin2 of L7400 :( Oh, well. At least we tried. Thank you Duke.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message: Usually this is a dead MCP. Only other thing is to inspect for corrosion or missing/damaged parts/traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
threads.message: Somewhere in particular, or corrosion could be just about anywhere? Thanks anyway.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low at 8.15V
